title: Client for the Bundesbank API
text: bbk minimal R client Bundesbank SDMX Web Service API.

title: Client for the Bundesbank API
text: can install released version treasury CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Client for the Bundesbank API
text: bbk functions prefixed bb_ follow naming convention API. usual workflow search time series key Bundesbank website use retrieve data either bb_data() bb_series depending needs.
code: library(bbk)  # fetch 10 year daily yield curve yield_curve <- bb_data(   flow = "BBSIS",   key = "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A",   start_period = "2020-01-01" ) yield_curve #> # A tibble: 1,102 × 8 #>   date       key            title category unit  unit_multiplier frequency value #>   <date>     <chr>          <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>           <chr>     <dbl> #> 1 2020-01-02 D.I.ZAR.ZI.EU… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.16 #> 2 2020-01-03 D.I.ZAR.ZI.EU… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #> 3 2020-01-06 D.I.ZAR.ZI.EU… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #> 4 2020-01-07 D.I.ZAR.ZI.EU… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #> 5 2020-01-08 D.I.ZAR.ZI.EU… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #> # ℹ 1,097 more rows

title: Client for the Bundesbank API
text: bundesbank: R scripts downloading time-series data Bundesbank rsdmx: R package reading SDMX data metadata. readsdmx: R package reading SDMX data metadata. pdfetch: R package downloading economic financial time series public sources.

what: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
text: Returns data given flow key

title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
code: bb_data(   flow,   key,   start_period = NULL,   end_period = NULL,   first_n = NULL,   last_n = NULL )

title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
text: flow character(1) flow query, 5-8 characters. See bb_metadata() available dataflows. key character(1) key query. start_period character(1) start date data. Supported formats: YYYY annual data (e.g., "2019") YYYY-S[1-2] semi-annual data (e.g., "2019-S1") YYYY-Q[1-4] quarterly data (e.g., "2019-Q1") YYYY-MM monthly data (e.g., "2019-01") YYYY-W[01-53] weekly data (e.g., "2019-W01") YYYY-MM-DD daily business data (e.g., "2019-01-01") NULL, start date restriction applied (data retrieved earliest available date). Default NULL. end_period character(1) end date data, format start_period. NULL, end date restriction applied (data retrieved recent available date). Default NULL. first_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve start series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL. last_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve end series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL.

title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
text: data.frame() requested data. columns : date date observation key time series key title title dataflow category category observation unit unit observation unit_multiplier unit multiplier observation frequency frequency observation value value observation

title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
text: https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-data

title: Returns data for a given flow and key — bb_data
code: # \donttest{ # fetch all data for a given flow and key bb_data("BBSIS", "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A") #> # A tibble: 6,782 × 8 #>    date       key           title category unit  unit_multiplier frequency value #>    <date>     <chr>         <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>           <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 1997-08-07 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.76 #>  2 1997-08-08 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.76 #>  3 1997-08-11 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.75 #>  4 1997-08-12 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.72 #>  5 1997-08-13 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.77 #>  6 1997-08-14 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.74 #>  7 1997-08-15 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.72 #>  8 1997-08-18 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.72 #>  9 1997-08-19 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.66 #> 10 1997-08-20 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily      5.71 #> # ℹ 6,772 more rows  # specified period (start date-end date) for daily data bb_data(   "BBSIS", "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A",   start_period = "2020-01-01",   end_period = "2020-08-01" ) #> # A tibble: 148 × 8 #>    date       key           title category unit  unit_multiplier frequency value #>    <date>     <chr>         <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>           <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 2020-01-02 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.16 #>  2 2020-01-03 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  3 2020-01-06 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  4 2020-01-07 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  5 2020-01-08 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  6 2020-01-09 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.22 #>  7 2020-01-10 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.2  #>  8 2020-01-13 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.19 #>  9 2020-01-14 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.17 #> 10 2020-01-15 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.22 #> # ℹ 138 more rows # or only specify the start date bb_data(   "BBSIS", "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A",   start_period = "2020-01-01" ) #> # A tibble: 1,102 × 8 #>    date       key           title category unit  unit_multiplier frequency value #>    <date>     <chr>         <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>           <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 2020-01-02 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.16 #>  2 2020-01-03 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  3 2020-01-06 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  4 2020-01-07 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  5 2020-01-08 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.27 #>  6 2020-01-09 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.22 #>  7 2020-01-10 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.2  #>  8 2020-01-13 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.19 #>  9 2020-01-14 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.17 #> 10 2020-01-15 D.I.ZAR.ZI.E… Yiel… GKZR     perc… 0               daily     -0.22 #> # ℹ 1,092 more rows # }

title: Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
text: Retrieval metadata stored Bundesbank's time series database. Access via SDMX Web Service API Bundesbank.

title: Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
text: type character(1) type metadata query. One : "datastructure", "dataflow", "codelist", "concept". id character(1) id query. Default NULL. lang character(1) language query, either "en" "de". Default "en".

title: Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
text: data.frame() queried metadata. columns : id id metadata name name metadata

title: Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
text: https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-metadata

title: Returns the available metadata — bb_metadata
code: # \donttest{ bb_metadata("datastructure") #> # A tibble: 73 × 2 #>    id        name                                                                #>    <chr>     <chr>                                                               #>  1 BBK_BSPL  Profit and loss                                                     #>  2 BBK_DOES  Short-term economic indicators (classified by economic sector)      #>  3 BBK_ERX   ECB euro reference exchange rates, exchange rates in particular co… #>  4 BBK_ESBOP External sector Balance of Payments according to BPM6               #>  5 BBK_EXBS  Business and consumer surveys of foreign countries                  #>  6 BBK_DOSC  System of  indicators for the German commercial real estate market  #>  7 BBK_DOSR  System of indicators for the German residential property market     #>  8 BBK_EXNA  National Accounts of foreign countries                              #>  9 BBK_EXPR  Consumer Prices of foreign countries                                #> 10 BBK_EXEI  Leading indicators of foreign countries                             #> # ℹ 63 more rows bb_metadata("dataflow", "BBSIS") #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   id    name                                 #>   <chr> <chr>                                #> 1 BBSIS Securities Issues Statistics (Bonds) bb_metadata("codelist", "CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY") #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   id                          name                 #>   <chr>                       <chr>                #> 1 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Assets / Liabilities #> 2 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Assets               #> 3 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Liabilities          bb_metadata("concept", "CS_BBK_BSPL") #> # A tibble: 38 × 2 #>    id          name                                          #>    <chr>       <chr>                                         #>  1 CS_BBK_BSPL Profit and loss                               #>  2 CS_BBK_BSPL Frequency (BBk)                               #>  3 CS_BBK_BSPL Area (countries, list of countries), BBk only #>  4 CS_BBK_BSPL Adjustment (BBk)                              #>  5 CS_BBK_BSPL Reference sector breakdown                    #>  6 CS_BBK_BSPL Profit/Loss Item                              #>  7 CS_BBK_BSPL Original maturity                             #>  8 CS_BBK_BSPL Data type                                     #>  9 CS_BBK_BSPL Counterpart area                              #> 10 CS_BBK_BSPL Counterpart Sector                            #> # ℹ 28 more rows # }

what: Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
title: Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
text: Returns time serie found specified time series key

title: Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
text: key character(1) key query.

title: Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
text: data.frame() requested data. columns : date date observation key time series key title title dataflow category category observation unit unit observation unit_multiplier unit multiplier observation frequency frequency observation last_update last update date source source data comment comment data value value observation

title: Returns the time serie that is found with the specified time series key — bb_series
text: https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-data
